questions.question: Installing the Customer Service Management plugin activates:
answers: A. Only one other plugin - Field Service Management Plugin
C. Only two other plugins - Portal and Case Management
D. Many other plugins at the same time

questions.question: From which places in ServiceNow can a customer service agent [sn_customerservice_agent] create a case? (Choose three.)
Which table must be extended when creating a new case type?

comments.content:
The first step in creating a case type is to create a table for the case type that extends the Case table (sn_customerservice_case).

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-csm-case-types.html

questions.question: What are benefits of me Conversation History feature? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Shorter calls for agents by reducing the time to search for information
B. A customized admin chat toolbar with emojis for agents to use in chat messages
C. Improved customer satisfaction as agents can respond to and resolve customer issues faster
D. Better language management by flagging key words and alerting chat managers when agents use one or more of those words

questions.question: What is the benefit of a phased release approach?
answers: A. Team members schedules are able to synchronize
B. More time to develop stories
C. Working across multiple systems of record
D. Delivery of core functionality quickly

questions.question: On the Customer Service Portal which personas can see work orders from their company hierarchy? (Choose two.)
What is the most efficient way to get cases to be dosed automatically after a few days?
answers: A. Set the property glide.auto.close.cases resolved to true
B. Create a workflow associated with cases with a timer that changes the state after a few days
C. Create a Scheduled job that looks at the resolved_at date
D. Activate the Auto Close Resolved Cases flow

comments.content: Answer: D. Activate the Auto Close Resolved Cases flow

Answer: D. Activate the Auto Close Resolved Cases flow

Explanation: Auto Close Resolved Cases Flow Designer flow closes the case, however, "This flow is not active by default."

source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/auto-close-customer-service-case.html

questions.question: Which roles can specify both skills and mandatory skills for cases and tasks? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Field service dispatchers (wm_dispatcher), field service technicians (wm_agent), customer service managers (sn_customerservice_manager), and customer service agents (sn_customerservice_agent) can specify both skills and mandatory skills for cases and tasks.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/mandatory-skills.html

questions.question: An account is a supported external customer and a contact is a user who is an employee of an account. How many accounts can a contact be associated with?

comments.content:
An account can have multiple contacts but a contact can be associated with only one account.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-csm-accounts-contacts.html

questions.question: What benefits can be gained by integrating CSM with Field Service Management? (Choose two.)
answers: C. Work orders can be created from a case
D. Customer can access work order details and tasks created for their case

questions.question: Guided decisions is a decision authoring and execution capability that dynamically guides agents to resolve complex cases. Guided decisions consist of decision trees. What is a decision tree?
answers: A. A step-by-step methodology for creating and solving different case types
B. A detailed check list for customer service teams
C. A multi-step process consisting of a series of questions answers, and guidance
D. A set of steps used to define a complex process

comments.content: C is correct because it is!

Guided decisions consist of decision trees. A decision tree is a multi-step process consisting of a series of questions, answers, and guidances.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/guided-decisions.html

questions.question: In the 'Action Status' column on a case list, what could a blue indicator dot mean?

comments.content:
A blue indicator highlights cases that need attention, such as cases that have been updated by customers or internal users and are waiting for input or review. In CSM Agent Workspace, cases that need attention also use a blue field highlight.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-service-case-action-status.html

questions.question: Customer service personnel who are allocated the customer service agent (sn_customerservice_agent) role are responsible for which of the following tasks? (Choose four.)
answers: A. Assist customers with questions, issues and problems
D. View, edit, and work on cases

comments.content:
Customer service agent
[sn_customerservice_agent]

An agent who assists customers and partners with questions, issues, and problems. This user creates cases, views and edits cases, and works with customers and subject matter experts to resolve cases.
A customer service agent typically supports a specific set of products across one or more communication channels. An agent can belong to one or more agent groups.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/r_RolesInstalledWithCustomerService.html

questions.question: The ServiceNow add-in for Microsoft Outlook enables you to manage workflows such as creating and updating contacts and cases from within Microsoft Outlook. How could this feature positively affect customer experience?
answers: A. As email is being used fewer agents would be required to create cases so service costs would go down
B. It is easier to report on data in emails which means managers would be better placed to track performance
C. It can lead to taster resolution of customer issues and faster response to customer inquiries
D. It would guarantee less wait time for customers who chose to call the customer service center

comments.content: I believe it should be C

questions.question: In ServiceNow’s CSM Application, what is an interaction?
answers: A. Any configuration item that has been made accessible to customers
B. A record that a Customer Service Agent uses to identify and resolve a question or an issue for an external customer
C. A binding agreement between two parties
D. A request for assistance made through a chat, phone call, or walk-up

comments.content: For me:  B & D - would be valid answers

Interactions provide a centralized location for all communication channels in the platform. Each interaction represents a request for assistance through a given channel, for example, a call or a chat.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-servicenow-platform/page/administer/interaction/concept/interaction-management.html

questions.question: Which services does a Customer (sn_customerservice.customer) have access to? (Choose two.)
answers: A. Can research questions issues, or problems, and create view and edit cases for only their own accounts
B. Can assign the roles to other contacts in the same account
C. Can view assets belonging to their account
D. Can edit information or roles for existing contacts

comments.content:
Customer
[sn_customerservice.customer]

Customer role for researching questions, issues, or problems. Customers can create cases and view and edit existing cases for themselves. They can also view a list of assets belonging to their accounts.

Answer:
	A. Can research questions issues, or problems, and create view and edit cases for only their own accounts
	C. Can view assets belonging to their account

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/sandiego-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-access-mgmt.html

questions.question: To which recipient types can targeted communications (publications) be sent? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
Create recipients lists for active publications.

The list of recipients for an article can include internal users, accounts, contacts, and consumers. When an article is published, the recipients on this list can view the article on the Customer or Consumer Service Portal. Recipients can also receive optional email notifications.

questions.question: What does viewing a customer’s install base enable customer service agents to do? (Choose two.)
answers: A. See the detailed configurations of the products and services deployed for a customer to determine me action needed
B. Monitor alerts for operational services and configuration items that affect service health
C. Trace information provided m a case to the right product or service to which it relates
D. Close an upsell of related products and services not yet purchased by a customer

comments.content:
Correct answer is AC
To enable support organizations to efficiently manage customer cases, both agents and customers need to have a common understanding of the products and services being used. For those same support organizations to efficiently manage customer cases, agents need the ability to:
•	Trace information provided in a case to the right product or service to which it relates.
•	See the detailed configurations detailed configurations of the products and services deployed for a customer to determine the action needed.

AC is correct... I have no idea why some people mistakes the answer...
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-install-base.html

questions.question: Which step in Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) would ensure the work was allocated to the appropriate agent?

comments.content:
Answer: B. Define Assignment Rules

Explanation: "How to assign work items – Define the assignment rules that determine the work items pushed to agents"

source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-servicenow-platform/page/administer/advanced-work-assignment/concept/awa-overview.html

replies:
From the doc it say this: Assignment rule
Criteria that determines how work items are pushed to the appropriate agent within a qualified assignment group.
How come the wrong answer has got more votes?

Should be B. Define Assignment Rules

quote: 

"How to assign work items – Define the assignment rules that determine the work items pushed to agents" (b)

While c. is where to route "Where to route – Define the work item queues and the routing rules, execution order, work item sort order, and strategy"

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-servicenow-platform/page/administer/advanced-work-assignment/concept/awa-overview.html

comments.content:
If we go by wording, it's C
.. official docs..
Use the ServiceNow® Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) for Customer Service Management feature to automatically assign work items to agents based on their availability, capacity, and skills. AWA for CSM pushes work to qualified agents using work item queues, routing conditions, and assignment criteria that you define. Agents see their assignments in their Agent Workspace inbox.
Assignment Rules makes the most sense.

Leaf level refers to the lowest level in a hierarchy.The leaf-level case types sit right above the data level.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Guided Decisions capability?
answers: A. Provide agents with an escalation guide
B. Dynamically assist agents through account management
C. Dynamically help agents to resolve complex cases
D. Provide agents with a knowledge guide

comments.content: Dynamically help agents to resolve complex cases
Contributor role is the correct answer

questions.question: Which feature enables employees to request support for themselves and for external customers?

comments.content:
Contributor Users is a feature that enables employees to request support not only for themselves but also for external customers. This feature allows users to act as contributors to cases or requests, providing them the capability to create and manage cases for both internal employees and external customers.
whereas,Account Management refers to managing customer accounts, including account details, billing, and related services. While important for customer interactions, it does not specifically enable employees to request support on behalf of themselves or external customers.

Contributor Users: These users may participate in tasks or processes but do not have a defined role to initiate or manage requests for external customers.
Account Management: This feature specifically supports creating and managing accounts, which can include the ability for employees to submit requests on behalf of themselves and others (such as external customers). It is designed for this purpose, making it the correct answer for the question.

-Contributor users
With contributor user roles, you can engage both internal and external users to assist in resolving customer issues and requests.

The contributor users feature provides unified customer support for internal and external customers. With this feature, you can serve internal and external customers through shared service teams and service organizations:
Enable service organizations to serve one another and external customers.
Enable employees to request support for themselves and for external customers.
​Enable middle office agents to work on specific tasks that are required to resolve cases.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/customer-service-contributor-users.html

Contributor Roles is the correct answer.
Fundamentals book

comments.content:
Enable this feature by activating the Auto Close Resolved Cases Flow Designer flow. You can also create a configuration that enables both the system and agents to exclude cases from auto closure.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/configure-auto-close-resolved-cases.html

questions.question: Which feature provides easy-to-configure integrations between the Now Platform and third-party Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) tools or platforms?
Which table does the Account (customer_account) table extend?

comments.content:
Customer (Accounts)
 

B2B Model

With the B2B model, both accounts and contacts can be supported. Customer relationships, especially primary contacts, and account teams must be set up to ensure the account can be managed and supported as formally agreed with the customer.

Account Data

The Account [customer_account] table stores the Account’s information, such as name, account number, primary contact, phone number, address, and company website address.

Account [customer_account] extends the Core Company [core_company]table in ServiceNow.
An account can have one or more associated cases, contacts, assets, service contracts, entitlements, relationships, etc.
Associated entities appear in related lists on the account form.

C is the right answer
Account [customer_account] extends the Core Company [core_company] table in ServiceNow

questions.question: Which combination of roles is restricted for security purposes?

comments.content: Partner admin is an external role and snc_internal is internal role which conflicts with the partner admin role

I am choosing D because snc_external is a general external role and  snc_customerservice_customer is a specific external role. Assigning both to one person violates any infosec rule providing such a wide range of general and specific permissions.

Internal Roles	External Roles
Business-to-business (B2B)
sn_customerservice_agent
sn_customerservice_manager
Business-to-business (B2B) Customer
sn_customerservice.customer
sn_customerservice.customer_admin
sn_customerservice.customer_case_manager
Business-to-consumer (B2C)
sn_customerservice.consumer_agent
sn_customerservice_manager
Business-to-business (B2B) Partner
sn_customerservice.partner
sn_customerservice.partner_admin
Business-to-consumer (B2C)
sn_customerservice.consumer

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/reference/r_RolesInstalledWithCustomerService.html
B is the right answer as snc_internal is an internal role and the other one is assigned to external users. Both the roles cannot be assigned to the same user.

questions.question: What must a system administrator configure to define a different approval workflow for an escalation request?

comments.content: Since a rule (B/conditions) is not a workflow, I am choosing C.

Escalation templates
An escalation template determines how an escalation request is processed by defining the following information:
The type of escalation (case or account)
If approval is required:
If no, the escalation request is automatically approved.
If yes, provide the approver list required by the default approval workflow or provide a different approval workflow.
The escalation watch list. Users added to the watch list receive email notifications when an escalation record is updated.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/concept/administer-case-account-escalation.html

questions.question: Which entity represents specific versions of products being sold to and supported for customers?

comments.content: Sold products is the entity that product model becomes after it has been sold to a customer.

A product model is a specific version or configuration of a product. Build hierarchical product models that represent the set of products that your organization offers to its customers and define relationships between different product models. 

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/c_CreateAProductModel.html

C is the right answer

•	A product model is a specific version or configuration of a product.

questions.question: After an assignment group is chosen, which mandatory step in Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) ensures the work is allocated to the appropriate agent?
answers: C. Set up Skills for Agents

comments.content:
Work assignments
Release version: 
Yokohama
UpdatedJan 30, 20254 minutes to readSummarize
After routing work items to the appropriate queues and corresponding agent groups, Advanced Work Assignment (AWA) pushes work to the most qualified agent using the assignment criteria that you specify. Assignment criteria revolve around the type of assignment rule (most capacity or last assigned) and whether skills are defined.

Administrators can choose to push work items to agents based on one of these assignment rules:
defining assignment rules is the mandatory step that ensures work is allocated to the appropriate agent after an assignment group is chosen.

It is absolutely D.

Queue is for routing (groups), assignment rules are for users
C is the correct answer because the question is "After an assigment group is chosen" it means the Assigment Rules chosen the group. The next step to assign an agent is "Set up skill for Agents"
A should be correct.. Assignment Rules are for Groups not for Agents.

C. Case Categorization
